bug.author: Cpache1
bug.description:
When I open the ml-agents Project in Unity and select one of the .demo files, I cannot see the metadata in the inspector. It has stopped showing me this. Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Open Project folder with Unity (2018.4.16f) Go to one of the example demos (Assets/ML-Agents/Examples/3DBall/Demos/Expert3DBall.demo Select it to see it in the Inspector Window I see blank
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23500321/76311708-7212ba80-62c9-11ea-8e5c-25acc6c0c7f7.PNG></denchmark-link>
I did notice there's a "Missing Mono Script" - I am wondering if that's the problem where is said script and how to add it? Environment:
Windows 10 ML-Agents version: ML-Agents v0.14.1 (latest_release) TensorFlow version: 2.0.0 Environment: 3DBall (and all others honestly)

comments.comment: Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Cpache1>@Cpache1</denchmark-link> , I've tried to reproduce this issue with no luck, the necessary script is present after a fresh clone of the repository. The script your missing is located here , but I would suggest re-cloning the repo as a whole to make sure you're not actually missing the file
I did have the script, although I don't understand why it wasn't doing what it was supposed to? I just downloaded the repo and copied over the "Project" folder. It fixed it. Thanks!
